metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27223 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Eclipse Jetty 9.4.6.v20170531 to 9.4.36.v20210114 (inclusive), 10.0.0, and 11.0.0 when Jetty handles a request containing multiple Accept headers with a large number of “quality” (i.e. q) parameters, the server may enter a denial of service (DoS) state due to high CPU usage processing those quality values, resulting in minutes of CPU time exhausted processing those quality values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27223` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

jetty9 - 9.4.48-1
libjetty9-extra-java - 9.4.48-1
libjetty9-java - 9.4.48-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jetty9 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.4.48-1').
